holidays.name: International Talk Like a Pirate Day
holidays.description: A playful day where everyone is encouraged to talk like a pirate‚Äîarr matey! Swashbuckle your way through conversations with 'Ahoy!' and 'Shiver me timbers!'
holidays.origin: Created in 1995 by John Baur and Mark Summers, two friends who decided to have fun by adopting pirate talk one day.
holidays.funFact: The day gained national attention when humorist Dave Barry wrote about it, sparking worldwide celebrations!

holidays.name: Rice Krispies Treats Day
holidays.description: A delightful day dedicated to the gooey, crunchy, and oh-so-yummy Rice Krispies Treats, perfect for nostalgic snacking.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the invention of the Rice Krispies Treat by Mildred Day and Malitta Jensen in 1939.
holidays.funFact: The original recipe called for just three ingredients: Rice Krispies cereal, butter, and marshmallows‚Äîstill the classic combo today!

holidays.name: Respect for the Aged Day (Japan)
holidays.description: A Japanese national holiday honoring elderly citizens, celebrating their wisdom and contributions with festivals and family gatherings.
holidays.origin: Established as a public holiday in 1966 to recognize a rapidly aging population.
holidays.funFact: On this day, it's common to see special events where communities present gifts and performances to senior citizens.

holidays.name: National Cheeseburger Day (United States)
holidays.description: A day to indulge in one of America's favorite handheld meals‚Äîthe cheeseburger, with all its melty, savory goodness.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday to celebrate the invention and popularity of the cheeseburger.
holidays.funFact: Though the cheeseburger's exact origin is debated, it rose to fame in the 1920s and has countless regional variations today!
